channel.title: Pregnancy on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections
channel.description: Recent content in Pregnancy on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections

item.title: A study of the distribution of aluminum in human placental tissues based on alkaline solubilization with determination by electrothermal atomic absorption spectrometry
item.description: 95% of women who gave birth had aluminum found in the placenta, 81% had it in the placental membrane, 46% - in the umbilical cord. This goes to the question of vaccinating pregnant women.

item.title: Aluminum incorporation into the brain of rat fetuses and sucklings
item.description: Pregnant rats were given subcutaneous injections of radioactive aluminum, which reached the embryo’s brain in just a couple of days. After the birth, the aluminum continued to accumulate in the brain, now passed on through the breast milk.

item.title: Association between maternal exposure to aluminum and the risk of congenital heart defects in offspring
item.description: High level of aluminum in mother’s hair is associated with congenital heart defects of the child.
